title: How to Paint Papier Mâché

steps.headline: Apply white Gesso all over your creation, making sure you paint Gesso into any corners and creases You may require several layers to ensure a smooth base all over, so let it dry completely between applications.
Once dry and smooth, begin to paint the colours.
steps.description: Begin with the larger areas first, and work smaller towards the details.

steps.headline: Use acrylic paint.
steps.description: It is the most popular paint for this, because it dries nice and bright, and it is also waterproof. Water colours are not waterproof, and dry in a dull soft way. You can also use household paint if your creation is quite large. Again, allow paint to dry between applications.

steps.headline: Once everything is painted, apply the details.
steps.description: These can be done using waterproof marker pens, wool for the hair (or fur!) and clothes. Beads, string and other household items can be added if applicable.

tyn: Brushes of assorted sizes, depending on size of creation
Paint (Acrylic or household paint is best)
Turps or white spirit for cleaning
